My bet, you are into massive cognitive dissonance. Have a good day.

> [cexy](#comment_24_1Fjz1g7unEcMnTRy7nc9WUBZdA7eHkc7BL): 60 GHz interferes with oxygen gas molecule and can lead to asphyxiation. I've been warned. Thnx

Exactly. There is probably a correlation. It is said that at 60Ghz, oxygen electrons spin faster, and then it is more difficult for hemoglobin to fix them, thus the respiratory insufficiency potentially caused by 5G, and the people dropping unconscious on the streets in 5G covered areas in China. 
An other possibility is that at 60Ghz, oxygen become ozon (so O2 becomes O3), and ozon cause, again, respiratory insufficiency. 
There are not a lot of material proof for this, because guess what, the 5G telecom carriers didn't do much research, and if they did, they didn't publish it, much like what happened with Big tobbaco, who knew cigarettes cause cancer since the 1950s/1960s, but didn't publish the results for obvious reasons. There are also no independant researches on the effect of 5G on health.
https://youtu.be/hsil3VQE5K4?t=157

1588406337_1Fjz1g7unEcMnTRy7nc9WUBZdA7eH.body: Intel management engine and AMD PSP are really not tolerable. I'll stay with the AMD fx 8xxx series. Most powerful CPUs without super all-in-one backdoor. When Capitalism become so shitty that you don't buy new products because they are more powerful but total spy and control technology.

> [mg0](#comment_290_1LbP2cNA6NkvuFJvs7McUmv9qGjkNqVkTa):  OpenPower

hm I'm all in favor for this OpenPower initiative, that said, IBM isn't really the kind of non profit organization you can easily thrust, is it?  Can i even easily run Linux Debian/Ubuntu, Fedora or Manjaro with an arch Power9?

> [cexy](#comment_64_1Fjz1g7unEcMnTRy7nc9WUBZdA7eHkc7BL): Is AMD FX 8350 Black Edition "Vishera" CPU (8 Core, AM3+, Clock 4.0 GHz, Turbo 4.2 GHz, 8 MB L3 Cache, 125 W)  within the group of CPUs you are talking about? Why would trust MD fx 8xxx series?

Yes i've done some searches, and from what i've read, the AMD FX  (all of them), are exempt of PSP backdoor. I've heard that they have some more primitive backdoor, but i don't know if that's true, only one person talked about that. 
I also need confirmation on those informations.

Apparently, all the AMD FX on am3+ motherboards are exempt of the PSP.
https://libreboot.org/faq.html#amd-platform-security-processor-psp
https://freundschafter.com/cybersecurity-cpu-and-system-alternatives-without-intel-me-iamt-and-amd-psp-secure-technology/

So, bulldozer core and piledriver core are exempt of the PSP.  On the other hand, Steamroller (FM2+) and Excavator (FM2+, AM4)  have the Platform security processor. 

In summary, those CPUs are exempt of PSP:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_AMD_FX_microprocessors

> [arione](#comment_20_1MWEiuQMdpFnEMLrRLSxEPJYB55u76WTjY): Do smarphone cpus have ME alikes? One of my friends told me that after several android phone factory resets there is a piece of malicious software that keeps coming back to the system as if unaffected by the reset. Or is android so full of backdoors that it could be them?

As far as i know Android is a gigantic backdoor. Google play store is closed source.

1620574964_1C6gAPEiSgWRPes1bmpFhWcKGyyT2.body:
> [xcape2net](#comment_847_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): I agree with deepstrelok.  As anyone who has used ZeroNet for any length of time can attest, users hosting content on their computers has some important drawbacks.  Though I love the idea of using a decentralized network like ZeroNet, it is not good for many things that we rely on the Internet for.  I think what will happen is that decentralized networks will supplement the clearnet, not replace it.  And, that's alright.

It seems what i call semi-decentralized, like activity pub (i don't like mastodon or peertube though), and hosted instances like the search engine searx , or fchan (https://fchan.xyz), are what's more practical today. 
You have the benefit of centralized platforms: speed, instant access, can upload files, can access from an old laptop or even a phone, but also the benefits of some decentralization: if there is some censorship, an other instance can open, and take if from here.

1624835115_129GZPA7VpPa3YaRRW2ani34CaowY.body: Hm it's still useful, even dead, in case there is an attack on the clearnet (DNS attack + major hosting servers attack). Would be a place to exchange information.
